segments.text: Can I help you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, please help me.  Where is my bag?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I need a little more information.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Where is my bag?  Come on, I've been here for four hours.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What- What flight did you come in on?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Okay, I'm coming in from Atlanta.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Georgia?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, Georgia.  Good for you I need my bag.  Can you...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There's no need for you to raise your voice, sir.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I've been college educated.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I speak your language.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Are you insinuating that I don't have a college education and that- for some reason that makes you a better person than I am?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen, shut your smug mouth, okay?  I don't need that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm just saying you don't need to talk to me like I-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I've been sitting here for four hours.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm not a child.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I've been here for sixteen.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You people have just been tossing me around like a used hanky.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I come here every single day.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You work here.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Details, Details.  Well, anyhow can I--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: so you flew in from Atlanta...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: My bag from Atlanta.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Four...Four hours ago.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a little black bag with wheels.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do you have any i-?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That you wouldn't let me put in the overhead compartment.  You said I had to check it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wouldn't let you?   I was not in Atlanta. I was not in Atlanta.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a tiny little bag.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I had nothing to do with the boarding attendance.  I'm sorry that your seat was wherever it was.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It was right in the middle of five different people.  I had a huge fat lady next me, a crying kid on left I went like can I please get a Bloody Mary, please? Will you bring a Bloody Mary?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I have some unfortunate news, uh, that your bag isn't going to be--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: --arriving any time soon.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Just had a really, really stressful day, okay?  And I need my bag; can you please help me get my bag?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm really sorry to tell you this but...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Okay.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's not.  I can offer you fifty dollars and a reimbursement gift cards for our airline...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: ...and your future...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm sorry, wait a minute.  Are you saying I'm not going to get my bag at all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's gone.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Where is it?  Where did it go?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We've actually...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You mean did someone steal it? Do people steal bags?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They do as matter of fact.  We don't like to publicize it because
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: people wouldn't Fly our airline.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Probably people that work for your company huh?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do you know what was in that little bag that I could have just easily put in overhead compartment but no I had to check?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What was that?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: My computer which has all of my data which I'm collecting right now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's unfortunate.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah it's really unfortunate you know why because I'm going to get fired if I don't get that.  So I need to have that back.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's too bad.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Fifty dollars is not going to cover me for my job, okay?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wish I could give it to you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well you need to find it. Can I just go back there and look through the bags?  Can I just go back there and just go through maybe I'll find it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wish I-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's not - no.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It'll be a lot more than what you're doing sitting here and just give me lip service.  I'd like to go back at least do some aggressive searching for my stuff.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We have plenty of aggressive searching going on it's not there.  Someone's taken it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Sure, yeah right you have plenty of aggressive searching going on, aggressive searching, drinking coffee and smoking cigarettes.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know what you guys do when you're not working you're union people; you just sit around on your ass.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know I don't need to take this sort of abuse.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, I don't need to take this kind of abuse either.  I just was trying get back to Atlanta. I just got home, I just want to get my bag and get my stuff. And keep my job.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's fantastic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Then why don't you take your fifty dollars. Get yourself a taxi and go shopping tomorrow.
